entry.title: How to extract images from pdf file on Ubuntu Desktop ?
entry.content:
Pdfimages in Ubuntu

If you have some pdf files which include images and want to extract all images like a image file, you can make it easily. Firstly, you should install poppler-utils in your machine, with

bash $ sudo apt-get install poppler-utils

After that you can see to pdfimages how using it, like

bash $ pdfimages --help

you install and look at your pdfimages properties with above commands. Now you should go to your pdf file path on terminal, then write on terminal this command,

bash $ pdfimages -j your_pdf_file.pdf which_name_you_want

you can see all images export in your pdf file in your path. It is very easy.

That’s all.
